0.Pros: Flexible Schedule. As an administrator I didn't have to deal with many of the direct customer complaints.
0.Cons: Worked for a franchised, so the owners refused to followed recommended guidelines set by corporate. Instead they paid less, scheduled fewer employees, and were more prone to dismiss hardworking employees. Overall, do not work for a franchise. Instead corporate is a lot better.

1.Pros: Easy working as long as you run the store
1.Cons: Couldn't keep good employee during stay

2.Pros: Nice environment if you keep to yourself.
2.Cons: You may have to out up with a lot of unneeded challenging from upper management.

3.Pros: Great atmosphere and fun working environment with great managers and great hours. Very easy to move up
3.Cons: Sometimes the scheduling was inconstant . Uniforms really did suck

4.Cons: having a boss young enough to be your own child

5.Pros: Great team and bosses that you get to work with. Very flexible scheduling and half-day Fridays!
5.Cons: Not enough work for the entire summer

6.Pros: It is a great learning experience...

7.Pros: One free meal comp per day
7.Cons: Unsanitary work go home smelling like grease

8.Summary: "good place to start, but not stay"
8.Pros: flexible schedules, fun place to work in, good place for a first job
8.Cons: management would sometimes send people home if there wasnt enough customers coming in. some managers expected too much of minimum wage workers. little room for advancement.

9.Pros: Free food at break. Partial uniform provided. Good exercise if you work like should. Store will always do well because of location.
9.Cons: Most employees lazy, bad attitude toward other employees and even customers. Employees didn't follow dress code and texted during shift. Managers bad attitudes toward employees and not following procedures.
